summary: This is a Bank of America personal signature card and substitute Form W-9 for a joint account, likely related to financial activities in the Epstein case. It includes account ownership details, survivorship options, and taxpayer identification certification.

persons.name: Ali-Sherif Weaker
persons.context: Appears as the bank associate handling the account opening, with name and phone number listed in the bank information section.

events.title: Bank Account Opening
events.description: A joint bank account is opened at Bank of America, with a personal signature card and Form W-9 completed.

keyFacts: A joint bank account was opened at Bank of America on November 15, 2012.
The account includes survivorship options, indicating it may be intended for multiple owners with rights of inheritance.
The document includes a Form W-9 for taxpayer identification, suggesting U.S. citizenship or residency of the account holder(s).
Bank associate Ali-Sherif Weaker is listed as the handling associate for the account.
The account type is indicated as DDA (Demand Deposit Account) or SAV (Savings), with options for CD (Certificate of Deposit).
